title: NotarX - Decentralized File Notary
description1: NotarX is a decentralized appplication (dApp) that can certify a file instantly using a smart contract deployed on the Ethereum blockchain. The dApp takes the file hash locally and writes it into the blockchain with a timestamp
lessons_learned: Learned how to take a problem and solve it using blockchain technology. Also learned how to choose the best blockchain for specific use cases

status.label: Active
status.details: This project is now released on the ropstein testnet

title: BlockchainLion
description1: A blog that accumulates knowledge on blockchain related topics. The contents are curated by me and the articles all serve to explain various topic related to decentralized technologies and cryptocurrencies
lessons_learned: Learned how to assimilate complex technical concepts and summarize them as easy-to-read articles. Also learned how to get traffic to my blog through SEO and some social media

status.label: Active
status.details: This project is active. I write articles whenever I have free time.

title: Decentralized Voting dApp
description1: A simple barebone voting web application that allows you to run a votation using the blockchain technology as its backbone. Specifically, the web app interacts with a smart contract deployed on the ethereum blockchain in order to register and retrieve votes
lessons_learned: This was the first dApp that I developed. It was a great introduction to smart contract programming

status.label: Offline
status.details: This project was not deployed live, but only on a local machine.

title: KEENN LLC
description1: Keenn is a boutique software development agency located in Miami FL. I co-founded it in 2017 together with another fellow computer science UM student. We solve problems of all kinds using software and automation and we have clients that go from small businesses to corporate enterprises. Check out more at keenn.com
lessons_learned: I learn every day how to grow a profitable service-based company. Since the problems to solve are always different, I learn how to be adaptable and to quickly get familiar with new concepts and tools.

status.label: Active
status.details: This company is currently active and legally operating in the state of Florida.

title: ItalianBartender
description1: ItalianBartender (ITB) is an online editorial that creates culturally relevant content about mixology and cocktails. In mid-2019 ITB became the #1 authority in Italy for all things bartendeing, mixology and bar chef. Our YouTube channel has plenty of cocktail recipes made by the some of the best bartenders in Italy
lessons_learned: Learned how to bootstrap an online editorial website from scratch. Learned how to effectively delegate marketing, social media and content creation to different partners. Also learned to understand traffic analytics and plan effective SEO and social campaigns.

status.label: Active
status.details: This company is currently active and legally operating in Italy.

title: CustomVolley
description1: CustomVolley is a niche e-commerce website made for volleyball players. The peculiarity of this online store is that athletes can use an interactive 3D configurator to create and buy 100% personalized volleyball gear and clothing. The clothing and gear are made and printed in italy.
lessons_learned: Learned how to bootstrap an ecommerce from scratch. Learned how to automate time-consuming repetitive tasks such as order forwarding, fulfilling and shipping. Learned how to effectively delegate marketing, social media and promotional content creation to different partners. Learned to understand traffic analytics and plan effective SEO and social campaigns to boost sales.

status.label: Active
status.details: This company is currently active and legally operating in Italy.

title: FROM?!? NBA Trivia
description1: I created this iOS app in 2018 during my internship at Blubeta, a Wynwood dev shop. The app connects to a Node backend that keeps track of the scores and activity. The mobile app has anti-cheating mechanisms and has a very intuitive UX.
lessons_learned: I learned a lot about mobile native apps and the whole apple store process to publish them. I also gained more experience in backend development and learned quickly a new NodeJS framework called LoopbackJS.

status.label: Discontinued
status.details: After my internship this app was put aside and therefore removed from the app store.

title: JamHero
description1: This web application is a platform for musicians to quickly find musical tracks to jam over. It was made as the final project of my IronHack web dev bootcamp. It won the #3 place at the IronHack Miami Hackshow in the summer of 2016.
lessons_learned: I learned the Ruby on Rails framework pretty deeply. Also earned experience in handling, deploying and maintaining a monolithic stack. Learned a lot of SQL as well and last but not least, the YouTube API.

status.label: Active
status.details: The platform is still online and has a niche community of musicians still using it.

title: Bitcoin Kenya
description1: I created this website in order to aggregate all the best Bitcoin resources/websites/platforms for Kenya residents. Kenya is one of the countries that in my opinion would get a lot of benefits from a more widespread Bitcoin adoption.
lessons_learned: I learned to use pre-rendered React. Specifically the PreactJS library. Also got more experience with front-end skills. On a side note I also learned more about the Bitcoin ecosystem in Kenya.

status.label: Active
status.details: This website is online and has traffic.

title: Invisible Glass
description1: I created a fast website for a company called Techlit, which was needed for the launch of a product called Invisible Glass. The website is made with modern JS-based frameworks and it is blazing fast
lessons_learned: Learned GatsbyJS in more detail. Learned how to optimize a site for speed and performace. Gained more experience with dealing with a corporate client as an independent contractor.

status.label: Active
status.details: This marketing site is  still online and used by the client to showcase his product.

title: Bricocenter Kiosk Web Interface
description1: I was commissioned to make a simple web interface to be placed on 1920x1080 kiosks in several Bricocenter retail locations in Italy.
lessons_learned: Developing web interfaces for screens different than the laptop and mobile ones.

status.label: Unknown
status.details: This web interface might or might not still be used in Bricocenter retail locations.
